taxonomicnotes: This species is thought to be part of a species complex   (M.  López-Mejía., F. Alvarez. and C. Pedraza-Lara pers. comm. 2009).
rationale: Cambarellus montezumae has been assessed as Least Concern.  This species has a relatively wide distribution across Mexico and is found in a variety of habitat types. It is abundant in at least some parts of its range and although the introduction of Common Carp for aquaculture may be causing some localized declines, at present this is not thought to represent a major threat to this species.
assessor: Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C.
